summary: "Warchief Armor" is a lore friendly, stand alone, heavy or light armor set for both males and females. This armor is a fusion of Orcish brutality, Nordic resilience, and tribal bloodlust. If you want to feel like a beastly barbarian marauding the countryside, this set is for you.
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/Ebx8s.png[/img][/center]
[center]An armor mod by Hothtrooper44.[/center]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/aEZjz.png[/img]
"Warchief Armor" is a lore friendly, stand alone, heavy or light armor set. This armor is a fusion of Orcish brutality, Nordic resilience, and tribal bloodlust. If you want to feel like a beastly barbarian marauding the countryside, this set is for you.

The armor has high attention to detail, and is covered with barbaric themed ornamentation such as skulls, a dagger, a coin pouch, various other bags/bones, etc. Note that there are two helmet variations: one that is very armored looking, and one that's looks like a saber-tooth cat pelt with an armor underlay.

The pieces are Dragon Bone quality in armor value and weight. Powerful as would befit a chief, but within the intended bounds of the game. No god-mode items here folks, this is a lore friendly set.

The set can be found under the Orcish section at a normal forge. The Orcish blacksmithing perk is required to craft and upgrade this set. The material requirements are similar to Orcish armor, but greater in some ways due to having higher statistics than Orcish.

The armor comes in heavy and light versions and is usable by both genders and all races. There is a version with and without skulls for the females.

[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/sczKi.png[/img][youtube]Yw3X4Vplx3g[/youtube][img]http://i.imgur.com/qtfnN.png[/img]
[color=orange]I make my own videos now! Feel free to subscribe to my youtube channel where I always post a video before I release a mod. =)[/color][/center]

[center]Feedback on the armor should be left in the comments section. I will read all the comments made and consider requests for alterations and potential fixes.

** If you like it, endorse it! **[/center]

[img]http://i.imgur.com/iKiyr.png[/img]
I would like to take this small space to thank the users of my mods, and the Nexus community at large. I am honored to be a part of this community, and to contribute to it. Thank you for your patronage of my work, whether it comes through comments, endorsements, or even a kind donation. You are the reason that I spend long hours of work bettering Skyrim. The Nexus community is the reason I continue to create mods. Thank you.

[img]http://i.imgur.com/kajpJ.png[/img]
If you wish to use this armor set's assets in another mod, please ask me by message first.
I do wish to help other mods and the community at large with my work, so don't hold back from asking!

[img]http://i.imgur.com/0r93l.png[/img]
hothtrooper44 - Warchief Armor
Bethesda - Skyrim and it's assets
The thin Bandolier belt's meshes and textures are owned and copyrighted by CD Projekt and used here with permission. The Witcher is a trademark of CD Projekt. All rights reserved. http://www.cdprojekt.com/
DVAted, TreasureChest(OG-Jay), LordOfWar, Targaryen, tumbajamba, asc_kel, Froda - [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=12583]their Sabretooth Cat helmet[/url]
1000stenar - the screenshots + [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=15386]check out his ENB [/url]
jangojoneshelljets - [url=http://jangojoneshelljets.deviantart.com/art/The-Warchief-301090118]Artwork[/url]
Melooo - the forearm bug fix implemented in v5
aoki, beargrylls, lumps, mannygt, Omesean - inspiration/help!
